name: Roast Turkey Whole
steps: You should definitely make Turkey Gravy to go with this roast!
Take the Turkey out of the fridge and let rest for ~20 minutes
Unpack the Turkey and set aside the neck/giblets for Turkey Stock
Place Turkey on a Roasting Rack over a Roasting Pan
Cut off any chunks of excess skin/bone/fat for Stock as well
Mix Salt, Sugar and Black Pepper together
Put on some food prep gloves (required, trust me)
Starting at the neck hole, wedge your hand between the meat and skin
Be sure to maintain the integrity of the skin as you push in
Keep working your hand deeper, separating skin from the breasts
Once the skin's detached from the breasts, work to the legs
The skin should be detached from the breasts and legs, and intact
Take 2/3 of the dry mix, spread evenly over the meat under the skin
Add Baking Powder to the remaining 1/3 of the dry mixture
Mix thoroughly and sprinkle/rub atop the skin of the bird
Tie the legs together with butcher's twine to keep cavity open
Tuck the wing tips under the Turkey (takes a little force)
Leave the Turkey in the fridge uncovered for 24 hours to dry
Take the Turkey out of the fridge
Remove the Turkey/Roasting Rack from the Roasting Pan
Put a pizza stone in the oven on the lowest rack
Ensure there's enough clearance in the oven for your bird to fit
Preheat to 400F convection (425F normal)
Drain/dry the Roasting Pan and place directly on the pizza stone
Let the oven, pan, and stone heat for an hour
Put on some food prep gloves (required, hurts otherwise)
Evenly spread 4/5 of the Turkey Butter Rub under the Turkey's skin
Evenly spread 1/5 of the Turkey Butter Rub atop the Turkey's skin
Cut the Lemon, and Halve the Onions and the Garlic Head
Stuff the Lemon, Onions, and Garlic Head into the bird's cavity
Take some Tin Foil and fold to cover the breasts
Press Tin Foil onto the breasts so it protects the white meat
Once the Roasting Pan has heated for an hour, take it out
Pour Olive Oil into the pan
Take the bird off the Roasting Rack and place directly on pan
Put the Pan/Bird back on the Pizza Stone and let fry for 45 minutes
Take the Pan/Bird out, and put the Bird back on the Roasting Rack
Change the oven temperature to 300F convection (or 325F normal)
Put the Rack/Bird back in the Pan, and roast another 3 hours
Every bird is different, use discretion and monitor every 15 minutes
Pull the Bird from the oven
Check the deepest part of the breast with a meat thermometer
If less than 160F, take out the termometer and put the bird back in
Once the breast hits 160F, take it out for carry-over to finish it
Let rest for an hour and a half at room temperature
After a half hour of resting, save drippings for Jake's Turkey Gravy
Warm a heatable serving plate for presenting carved turkey bits
After the 1.5 hour rest, carve the turkey, keeping skin on pieces
comments: Save the drippings from roasting and use to make Jake's Turkey Gravy!
Be sure that your turkey is cooked to 165F, use a thermometer
"Cavity is just a nice way to say butthole" - Mahatma Gandhi
